Param.Name: Delay after sending sleep

Param.Name: HW flow control
Param.Desc: Flow control: 0 = Do not change. 1 = Change to HW (CTS/RTS)

Param.Name: Restarsmit_Timeout
Param.Desc: In BT Frames (x 1.25ms), Minimum time before retransmision

Param.Desc: 0 - Stop PCM loopback operation, 1 - Start PCM loopback operation

Param.Desc: Start VS Commands Lock according package (start of protected part of script)

Param.Desc: HCIPP enables/disables the BRF6300 BB PLL

Param.Name: Number of temperature ranges

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: ontrol the number of command buffers reported to the host

Param.Name: Cmd control
Param.Desc: Number of maximum command buffers to report to the host. (1-4)

Param.Name: PCM clock rate
Param.Desc: [64-16000] The PCM clock rate is between 64k to 4096k (Master mode) or 64K to 16M (Slave mode), it influence other params like: wait cycles, freq rate calcs and therefore shall be configured even if external clock is used

Param.Name: PCM direction/role
Param.Desc: PCM clock and fsync direction: 0x00 - output (Master on PCM bus) sampled on rising edge. 0x01 - input (Slave on PCM bus).

Param.Name: Frame sync frequency
Param.Desc: [100Hz-173KHz] Actual frame sync frequency in Hz.

Param.Name: Frame sync duty cycle
Param.Desc: 0x0000 - 50 % of Fsync period, [0x0001-0xFFFF] - Number of PCM clock cycles

Param.Name: Frame sync edge
Param.Desc: 0x00 - Driven/sampled at rising edge, 0x01 - Driven/sampled at falling edge

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH1 data out size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH1 data out offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH1 out_edge
Param.Desc: Data driven: 0x00 - rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: CH1 data in size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH1 data in offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH1 in_edge
Param.Desc: Data sampled: 0x00- rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH2 data out size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH2 data out offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH2 out_edge
Param.Desc: Data driven: 0x00 - rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: CH2 data in size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: CH2 data in offset
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: CH2 in_edge
Param.Desc: Data sampled: 0x00- rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: PCM clock shutdown
Param.Desc: PCM clock shutdown feature: 0x00 - disabled. 0x01 - enabled. Time of start stop is defined in the following 2 fields.

Param.Name: PCM clock start
Param.Desc: [0x0000-0xFFFF] Number of PCM clock cycles relative to the PCM frame sync to start PCM clock (for example - start 2 clocks before frame sync).

Param.Name: PCM clock stop
Param.Desc: [0x0000-0xFFFF] Number of PCM clock cycles relative to the PCM frame sync to stop PCM clock (for example - stop 20 clocks after frame sync).

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH1 data in order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH1 data out order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH1 data out mode
Param.Desc: 0 - Always 3-state (input), 1 - Always output, 2 - Switch to 3-state (input) when idle

Param.Name: CH1 data out dup
Param.Desc: 0 - Retransmit last sample when no data available, 1 - Transmit DUP_VALUE when no data available

Param.Name: CH1 tx_dup_value
Param.Desc: Replacement value to transmit when no data is available. ONLY 24-bits

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: CH2 data in order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH2 data out order
Param.Desc: bit 0: 0-Data driven MSB-first; bit 1: 1-swap bytes within the sample in bit-wise mode; bit 2: 1-Shift sample by (24|16-dout_size) bits

Param.Name: CH2 data out mode
Param.Desc: 0 - Always 3-state (input), 1 - Always output, 2 - Switch to 3-state (input) when idle

Param.Name: CH2 data out dup
Param.Desc: 0 - Retransmit last sample when no data available, 1 - Transmit DUP_VALUE when no data available

Param.Name: CH2 tx_dup_value
Param.Desc: Replacement value to transmit when no data is available. ONLY 24-bits

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: This field is reserved for future use - Must be set to 0.

Param.Name: inactivity_timeout
Param.Desc: Time from UART inactivity to sending SLEEP_IND. 0=BT never sends sleep_ind. Unit=Frames, 80 =100msec

Param.Name: RESERVED (retransmit_timeout)
Param.Desc: 0xFFFF=ignore this field. Timeout for resending WAKEUP_IND. 0=no retransmission. Unit=Frames

Param.Name: RESERVED (rts_minimum_pulse_width)
Param.Desc: 0xFF=ignore this field. RTS pulse may accompany WAKEUP_IND packet. 0=disable pulse. Unit=Micro seconds

Param.Name: Lines to sniff
Param.Desc: Bitmask of lines to be sniffed

Param.Name: Uart Baudrate
Param.Desc: new baud Rate - in bit/sec units.

Param.Desc: 0 - Output changed on falling edge, Sampling on rising edge, 1 - Output changed on rising edge, Sampling on falling edge

Param.Desc: 0 - BTSPI MISO is output always , 1 - BTSPI MISO is in tri-state mode when the CS is de-asserted

Param.Desc: Time in milisec between one logger printing to another not including sleep time

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP Setup Gemini interface in ORCA

Param.Name: Enable Mode
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't Change; 0x0 - 0x3-Reserved; 0x4-Soft Gemini Palau; 0x5-Soft Gemini Borneo

Param.Name: PA Configuration
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; bit0 - PA off polarity (0 = Active Low)

Param.Name: Connection handle select
Param.Desc: 0x0-0xEFF - select the connection handle; 0xF000 - Disable priority on all handles; 0xFFFF - Don't change

Param.Name: Freq_mask_enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Do not change; 0x0 - No Freq mask; 0x1 - Enable freq mask on WLAN 0; 0x2 - Enable freq mask on WLAN 1; 0x3 - Enable freq mask on WLAN0 and WLAN1

Param.Name: WLAN013_BT_IP_selected_pin
Param.Desc: 0: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 on the FM_I2S i/f ports, WLAN0 on FM_I2S_DI, WLAN1 on FM_I2S_WS, WLAN3 on FM_I2S_DO 1: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 on the FM I2C i/f ports, WLAN0 on FM_IRQ, WLAN1 on FM_SDA, WLAN3 on FM_SCL 2: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 as seen below, WLAN0 on BT_FUNC2, WLAN1 on BT_FUNC1, WLAN3 on FM_I2S_DO

Param.Name: WLAN2_BT_IP_selected_pin
Param.Desc: 0: Mux WLAN2 on the FM_I2S_CLK port, 1: Mux WLAN2 on the CLK_REQ_OUT

Param.Name: Wlan0 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled

Param.Name: Wlan1 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled

Param.Name: Wlan2 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled

Param.Name: Wlan3 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP Setup sync scans to GSM wakeup

Param.Name: Enable Mode
Param.Desc: 0x0 - Enable; 0x1-Enable on BT_FUNC1; 0x2-Enable on BT_FUNC2; 0x3-Enable on BT_FUNC3; 0x4-Enable on BT_FUNC4;0x5-Enable on BT_FUNC5; 0x7-Enable on BT_FUNC7; 0xFF-Disable

Param.Name: Clock active pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0x0 - Input pull disabled; 0x1 Input pull enabled

Param.Name: min page scan interval
Param.Desc: Minimal interval in baseband slots between page scans. Range 0x0012 - 0x1000

Param.Name: min inquiry scan interval
Param.Desc: Minimal interval in baseband slots between inquiry scans. Range 0x0012 - 0x1000

Param.Name: IRQ wakeup type
Param.Desc: The type of the wakeup: 0x0 - Slow, 0x1 - Fast; 0xFF do not change

Param.Name: Enable flag
Param.Desc: When set to 1, indicates enabling of power management algorithm

Param.Name: min_pkts_acl
Param.Desc: Minimum number of packets to calculate CRC statistics

Param.Name: power_decision_time
Param.Desc: The interval, in which a decision is made whether to increase/decrease or not to change peer tx power (decision interval = power_decision_time x100ms)

Param.Name: power_acl_response_time
Param.Desc: On ACL channel the minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to increase power (delay interval = power_decision_time x power_response_time x 100ms)

Param.Name: power_sco_response_time
Param.Desc: On E/SCO channel the minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to increase power (delay interval = power_decision_time x power_response_time x 100ms)

Param.Name: power_edr3_response_time
Param.Desc: On EDR3 channel the minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to increase power (delay interval = power_decision_time x power_response_time x 100ms)

Param.Name: power_delay_time
Param.Desc: The minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to decrease power (delay interval = power_delay_time x power_decision_time x 100ms)

Param.Name: deep_fade_rssi_delta1 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the previews measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-1])

Param.Name: deep_fade_rssi_delta2 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the one before the preview measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-2])

Param.Name: deep_fade_edr3_rssi_delta1 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the previews measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-1]

Param.Name: deep_fade_edr3_rssi_delta2 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the one before the preview measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-2])

Param.Name: Enable flag
Param.Desc: 0=Disabled 1=Enabled. When set to 1, indicates enabling of the CQDDR algorithm.

Param.Name: rssi_on_max_slot_1_thr
Param.Desc: -100..100. The RSSI threshold for changing the CQDDR state to EDR2 when max slot is 1.

Param.Name: rssi_off_max_slot_1_thr
Param.Desc: -100..100. The RSSI threshold for changing the CQDDR state to EDR3 when max slot is 1.

Param.Name: rssi_on_max_slot_3_thr
Param.Desc: -100..100. The RSSI threshold for changing the CQDDR state to EDR2 when max slot is 3.

Param.Name: rssi_off_max_slot_3_thr
Param.Desc: -100..100. The RSSI threshold for changing the CQDDR state to EDR3 when max slot is 3.

Param.Name: rssi_on_max_slot_5_thr
Param.Desc: -100..100. The RSSI threshold for changing the CQDDR state to EDR2 when max slot is 5.

Param.Name: rssi_off_max_slot_5_thr
Param.Desc: -100..100. The RSSI threshold for changing the CQDDR state to EDR3 when max slot is 5.

Param.Name: ber_fec_on_thr

Param.Name: ber_fec_off_thr
Param.Desc: 0..65535. The BER threshold for changing the CQDDR state to FEC_OFF.

Param.Name: ber_fec_off_esco_thr
Param.Desc: 0..65535. The BER threshold for changing the CQDDR state to FEC_OFF at eSCO connection. ***RESERVED***

Param.Name: per_fec_on_max_slot_1_thr
Param.Desc: 0..255. The PER percentage threshold (1unit = 10%) for changing the CQDDR state to EDR2 when max slot is 1. ***RESERVED***

Param.Name: per_fec_off_max_slot_1_thr
Param.Desc: 0..100. The PER percentage threshold (1unit = 10%) for changing the CQDDR state to EDR3 when max slot is 1. ***RESERVED***

Param.Name: per_fec_on_max_slot_3_thr
Param.Desc: 0..100. The PER percentage threshold (1unit = 10%) for changing the CQDDR state to EDR2 when max slot is 3.

Param.Name: per_fec_off_max_slot_3_thr
Param.Desc: 0..100. The PER percentage threshold (1unit = 10%) for changing the CQDDR state to EDR3 when max slot is 3. ***RESERVED***

Param.Name: per_fec_on_max_slot_5_thr
Param.Desc: 0..100 The PER percentage threshold (1unit = 10%) for changing the CQDDR state to EDR2 when max slot is 5.

Param.Name: per_fec_off_max_slot_5_thr
Param.Desc: 0..100. The PER percentage threshold (1unit = 10%) for changing the CQDDR state to EDR3 when max slot is 5. ***RESERVED***

Param.Name: timer_thr
Param.Desc: 0..100. The minimum time (1 unit = 400ms) before returning to EDR3 due to good hec & crc. ***RESERVED***

Param.Name: Enable/Disable Cqddr in Tx/Rx
Param.Desc: 0x00:tx disable,rx disable;0x10:tx enable,rx disable;0x01:tx disable,rx enable;0x11;tx enable,rx enable

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: HCIPP configures the BTIP fast clock configuration

Param.Name: Fast wakeup enable
Param.Desc: 0x00 - disabled For BT and FM. 0x01 - enabled For BT, disabled for FM. 0x10 - enabled For FM, disabled for BT. 0x11 - enabled For BT and FM. 0xFF - Dont Change.

Param.Name: XTAL Boost Gain
Param.Desc: This parameter determines the initial gain of the OSC cell

Param.Name: XTAL Normal Gain
Param.Desc: This parameter determines the steady state gain of the OSC cell

Param.Name: BT TX Slicer Trim
Param.Desc: This parameter determines the Slicer gain when BT is during TX/RX

Param.Name: BT Idel Slicer Trim
Param.Desc: This parameter determines the Slicer gain when BT is during TX/RX

Param.Name: Polarity
Param.Desc: 0- Active Low Polarity, 1- Active High Polarity

Param.Name: Pattern length in ACTIVE
Param.Desc: number of scans in an AFH pattern, value must be less than 16

Param.Name: Pattern length in SHORT_SNIFF (only)
Param.Desc: number of scans in an AFH pattern, value must be less than 16

Param.Name: Pattern length in LONG_SNIFF (only)
Param.Desc: number of scans in an AFH pattern, value must be less than 16

Param.Name: SHORT to LONG SNIFF transition threshold
Param.Desc: Threshold Tsniff period which will be considered as short / longsniff [in slots ] comparison is minimal_T_sniff to threshold , minimal_T_sniff includes subrating

Param.Name: Active pattern timing array
Param.Desc: array holding the number of idle frames between scans (in a pattern) each nibble (value 1 to 15) represents the time between two scans nibble 0,(byte[0] bits[3:0] is the number of frames between the first and second scan nibble 1,(byte[0] bits[7:4] is the number of frames between the second and third scan

Param.Name: Const interferer sequence count
Param.Desc: the number of scans where a narrow band interferer must be seen in order to be classified as bad (and removed)

Param.Name: Clear channel sequence count
Param.Desc: the number of patterns where a channel must be clean in order to be classified as good (and returned)

Param.Name: Increase priority rejection threshold
Param.Desc: the number of times an AFH scan can be "bumped" by other activities before raising its priority

Param.Name: Number of slots between scan patterns
Param.Desc: the number of slots from the end of a pattern to the activation of another

Param.Name: C_to_I threshold 0 2
Param.Desc: threshold between grade 0 to 2, 17dB = 7.07 >> times 10 is 71

Param.Name: C_to_I threshold 2 3
Param.Desc: threshold between grade 2 to 3, 15dB = 5.6 >> times 10 is 56

Param.Name: C_to_I threshold 3 4
Param.Desc: threshold between grade 3 to 4, 10dB = 3.1 >> times 10 is 31

Param.Name: RSSI level 1 for threshold shift
Param.Desc: RSSI level 1 in which the C/I to GRADE thresholds are updated

Param.Name: RSSI level 2 for threshold shift
Param.Desc: RSSI level 2 in which the C/I to GRADE thresholds are updated

Param.Desc: How many channels to look forward / backward from current channel for wideband interferer detection

Param.Desc: How many channels in side window need to be bad inorder for channel to be classified as having a wideband interferer

Param.Name: Wideband detection full window threshold
Param.Desc: How many channels in entire window need to be bad inorder for channel to be classified as having a wideband interferer

Param.Name: Pattern Detection Errors within window

Param.Name: Pattern Detection Margin
Param.Desc: Good channels that will be removed from each margin

Param.Name: CCM sample period
Param.Desc: How many times CCM is update before reading CCM results (unit of 25mS)

Param.Name: Accumulate threshold
Param.Desc: How many times CCM results are read before processing data (units of "CCM sample period")

Param.Name: Min hits th 1
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is above "TH switch RSSI": Minimal number of HEC events for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests)

Param.Name: Good HEC percent TH 1
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is above "TH switch RSSI":Percentage of good HEC for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests)

Param.Name: Min SNR th 1
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is above "TH switch RSSI":Minimal PHY SNR for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests), in dB

Param.Name: Min hits th 2
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is below "TH switch RSSI": Minimal number of HEC events for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests)

Param.Name: Good HEC percent TH 2
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is below "TH switch RSSI":Percentage of good HEC for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests), in percent

Param.Name: Min SNR th 2
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is below "TH switch RSSI":Minimal PHY SNR for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests), in dB

Param.Name: TH switch RSSI
Param.Desc: RSSI level at which other thresholds are switched, in dBm

Param.Name: HV1 return channel threshold
Param.Desc: minimal munber of good channels allowed in HV1, when reaching this number all channels are returned

Param.Name: HV1 return timer
Param.Desc: time in seconds for channel return in HV1 (stand alone timer, not restared at channel drop)

Param.Name: Table select
Param.Desc: 0 - print debug map 0 1 - print debug map 1 2 - print debug map 2 3 - print debug map 3

Param.Name: Channel to print
Param.Desc: Channel for which grade and C2I will be printed (if bit in mask is high)

Param.Name: Power 1
Param.Desc: power 1 != 0 for loop to work [if(power1) {....}] make sure bit 11 of debug mask is high (0x00000400) - to print logs of dBm_to_geortzel calc */

Param.Name: Power 2
Param.Desc: power 1 must be larger than power 2, loop while (p1>=p2){... p1-=power step}

Param.Name: Power step
Param.Desc: power step must be possitive , (step >0) uints in [db]

Param.Name: PHY store disable
Param.Desc: When high, PHY does not store its results, they can be written through HCI script

Param.Name: ref Power

Param.Name: ref Goertzel

Param.Name: Coex enable bitmap
Param.Desc:
Bit 0: report spur channels as bad in FM_RX Bit 1: report spur channels as bad in FM_TX Bit 2: AFH will be activated only in EDR Bit 3: switch PLL mode (band) Bit 4: switch OCP dividers Bit 5: disable FM synt offset (ignore offset) Bit 6: when in long sniff only, force basic data rate packets
Bit 15: enable debug messages for logger

Command.name: HCI_ACL_Data
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _text_ = %2 _bdry_ = %3 _brdcst_ = %4
_size_ = size(_text_)
_handle_ |= (((_bdry_ & 3)<<12) | ((_brdcst_ & 3) << 14))
_data_ = todata(2, 1) _data_ += todata(_handle_, 2)
if (g_bACL_L2CAP) then _data_ += todata(_size_, 2) _data_ += _text_ else _data_ += todata(_size_+4, 2) _data_ += todata(_size_, 2) _data_ += todata(0xDAD1, 2) _data_ += _text_ end if
WritePort _data_

Command.name: HCI_ACL_Data_Event
Command.Macro:
_timeout_ = %1 _handle_ = %2 _bdry_ = %3 _text_ = %4 _brdcst_ = %5
_size_ = size(_text_)
Wait_HCI_ACL_Packet_Event _timeout_, _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, &_data_
if (!g_bACL_L2CAP) then # discard the L2CAP part _data_ = mid(_data_, 4) end if
if 0 != strcomp(_text_, _data_) then Fail "Text mismatch. Expected: \"%s\", Got: \"%s\"", _text_, str(_data_) end if

Param.Name: Timeout
Param.Desc: Time in msec to wait for the event

Command.name: HCI_L2CAP_Packet_Data
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _cid_ = %2 _data_ = %3 _brdcst_ = %4
# Only on init if _acl_size_ > 0 && _acl_count_ > 0 then # Already set, Do nothing else _acl_size_ = 0 _acl_count_ = 0 _acl_available_ = 0 end if
# Make sure we have the size of ACL packets and the buffers count if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Send_HCI_Read_Buffer_Size Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_Read_Buffer_Size_Event 5000, any, HCI_Read_Buffer_Size, 0, &_acl_size_, any, &_acl_count_, any end if
# If still no information the error if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Fail "ACL Buffer Size Error" end if
_acl_available_ = _acl_count_
# Create the whole payload (to be splited later for each ACL _data_ = todata(size(_data_), 2) + todata(_cid_,2) + todata(_data_) _size_ = size(_data_)
_pos_ = 0 _segment_ = _acl_size_
if _segment_ > 0 then while _pos_ < _size_
# Loop on all free buffers available while _pos_ < _size_ && _acl_available_ > 0 abPayload = mid(_data_, _pos_, _segment_) Send_HCI_ACL_Packet _handle_, _pos_==0 ? 2 : 1, _brdcst_, todata(abPayload) _pos_ += _segment_ _acl_available_-- wend
Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend
# Wait for all completed events that still need to come up while _acl_available_ < _acl_count_ Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend end if

Command.name: HCI_L2CAP_Packet
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _cid_ = %2 _data_ = %3 _brdcst_ = %4
# Only on init if _acl_size_ > 0 && _acl_count_ > 0 then # Already set, Do nothing else _acl_size_ = 0 _acl_count_ = 0 _acl_available_ = 0 end if
# Make sure we have the size of ACL packets and the buffers count if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Send_HCI_Read_Buffer_Size Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_Read_Buffer_Size_Event 5000, any, HCI_Read_Buffer_Size, 0, &_acl_size_, any, &_acl_count_, any end if
# If still no information the error if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Fail "ACL Buffer Size Error" end if
_acl_available_ = _acl_count_
# Create the whole payload (to be splited later for each ACL _data_ = todata(size(_data_)+1, 2) + todata(_cid_,2) + todata(_data_) + todata(0, 1) _size_ = size(_data_)
_pos_ = 0 _segment_ = _acl_size_
if _segment_ > 0 then while _pos_ < _size_
# Loop on all free buffers available while _pos_ < _size_ && _acl_available_ > 0 abPayload = mid(_data_, _pos_, _segment_) Send_HCI_ACL_Packet _handle_, _pos_==0 ? 2 : 1, _brdcst_, todata(abPayload) _pos_ += _segment_ _acl_available_-- wend
Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend
# Wait for all completed events that still need to come up while _acl_available_ < _acl_count_ Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ wend end if

Command.name: HCI_L2CAP_Packet_Event
Command.Macro:
_timeout_ = %1 _handle_ = %2 _cid_ = %3 _text_ = %4
_size_ = size(_text_) _got_ = 0
while _got_ < _size_ Wait_HCI_ACL_Packet_Event _timeout_, _handle_, _got_==0 ? 2 : 1, any, &_data_
if (_got_==0) then
# Match CID _cidin_ = val(mid(_data_, 2, 2)) if _cid_ != _cidin_ then Fail "CID mismatch. Expected: 0x%04x, Got: 0x%04x", _cid_, _cidin_ end if
_whole_ = mid(_data_, 4) _got_ += size(_data_) - 4
else
_whole_ += _data_ _got_ += size(_data_)
end if
wend
# Match text if 0 != strcomp(_text_, _whole_) then Fail "Text mismatch. Expected: \"%s\", Got: \"%s\"", _text_, str(_whole_) end if

Param.Name: Timeout
Param.Desc: Time in msec to wait for the event

Command.name: HCI_ACL_Data_Types
Command.Macro:
_handle_ = %1 _type_ = %2 _path_ = %3 _bdry_ = %4 _brdcst_ = %5 _fmt_ = %6
If _type_==1 Then Send_HCI_ACL_L2CAP_Text _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, 0xDad1, _path_ Else # Extract the file name without the path _pos_ = InStrRev(_path_, "\\")
if (_pos_ >= 0) then _name_ = mid(_path_, _pos_+1) else _name_ = _path_ end if
if _fmt_==2 then LoadFile _FileData_, _path_ _size_ = size(_FileData_) Send_HCI_L2CAP_Packet_Data _handle_, 0xDA00, todata(_name_) + todata(0, 1) + _FileData_, _brdcst_ else # Only on init if _acl_size_ > 0 && _acl_count_ > 0 then # Already set, Do nothing else _acl_size_ = 0 _acl_count_ = 0 _acl_available_ = 0 end if
# Make sure we have the size of ACL packets and the buffers count if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Send_HCI_Read_Buffer_Size Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_Read_Buffer_Size_Event 5000, any, HCI_Read_Buffer_Size, 0, &_acl_size_, any, &_acl_count_, any end if
# If still no information the error if _acl_size_ == 0 || _acl_count_ == 0 then Fail "ACL Buffer Size Error" end if
_acl_available_ = _acl_count_
############################## # Write Header ##############################
LoadFile _FileData_, _path_
_size_ = size(_FileData_) abHeaderData = todata(_size_, 4) + todata(_name_) + todata(0, 1)
Send_HCI_ACL_L2CAP_Data _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, 0xDada, abHeaderData
_acl_available_-- _pos_ = 0 _segment_ = _acl_size_ - 4
if _segment_ > 0 then while _pos_ < _size_
# Loop on all free buffers available while _pos_ < _size_ && _acl_available_ > 0 abPayload = mid(_FileData_, _pos_, _segment_) Send_HCI_ACL_L2CAP_Data _handle_, _bdry_, _brdcst_, 0xDada, abPayload _pos_ += _segment_ _acl_available_-- wend
Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ WEnd
# Wait for all completed events that still need to come up while _acl_available_ < _acl_count_ Wait_HCI_Number_Of_Completed_Packets_Event 45000, 0x01, _handle_, &_freed_ _acl_available_ += _freed_ WEnd End If End If End If

Param.Name: Timeout
Param.Desc: Time in msec to wait for the event

Param.Desc: ms, Make sure that max value range for deassertion timer in DOT must be smaller than deassertion timer in sleep protocol configurations VS.

Param.Name: SDIO Sleep Mode
Param.Desc: 0 - Commands will wake up the device, 1 - SDIO Clocks will wakeup the device

Param.Name: SDIO min wake time before sending commands
Param.Desc: Time (in us) between waking up the device and sending the first packet (relevant when clocks will wakeup the device)

Param.Name: SDIO destination
Param.Desc: 0 - Legacy mode, 1 - Shared SDIO, BT 2 - Shared SDIO, WLAN

Param.Name: SDIO destination
Param.Desc: 0 - Legacy mode, 1 - Shared SDIO, BT 2 - Shared SDIO, WLAN

Param.Name: Block Mode and Opcode
Param.Desc: 0 - R/W from fixed address, 1 - R/W from incrementing address

Param.Name: SDIO destination
Param.Desc: 0 = Legacy mode, 1 = Shared SDIO, BT 2 = Shared SDIO, WLAN

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: Configure codec emulator. This command stops the sco generation.

Param.Name: Emulator clock rate
Param.Desc: [64-16000] The PCM clock rate is between 64k to 4096k (Master mode) or 64K to 16M (Slave mode), it influence other params like: wait cycles, freq rate calcs and therefore shall be configured even if external clock is used

Param.Name: Emulator role
Param.Desc: PCM clock and fsync direction: 0x00 - output (Master on PCM bus) sampled on rising edge. 0x01 - input (Slave on PCM bus).

Param.Name: Frame sync frequency
Param.Desc: [100Hz-173KHz] Actual frame sync frequency in Hz.

Param.Name: Frame sync duty cycle
Param.Desc: 0x0000 - 50 % of Fsync period, [0x0001-0xFFFF] - Number of PCM clock cycles

Param.Name: Frame sync edge
Param.Desc: 0x00 - Driven/sampled at rising edge, 0x01 - Driven/sampled at falling edge

Param.Name: Data out size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: Data out offset ch1
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: Data out offset ch2
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: Data out edge
Param.Desc: Data driven: 0x00 - rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: Data in size
Param.Desc: [0x0001-0x0280] Sample size in bits for each codec fsync. In case data size is greater than 24 bits, the size should be able to divide by 8.

Param.Name: Data in offset ch1
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: Data in offset ch2
Param.Desc: [0x00-0xFF] Number of pcm clock cycles between rising of frame sync to data start.

Param.Name: Data in edge
Param.Desc: Data sampled: 0x00- rising edge, 0x01 - falling edge

Param.Name: RX Delay Interrupt -> CS
Param.Desc: Delay between Interrupt line assertion until CS assertion [u sec]

Param.Name: TX Delay Interrupt -> Header
Param.Desc: Delay between Interrupt line assertion until header (type1) is sent [u sec]

Param.Name: RX Delay CS -> Header
Param.Desc: Delay between CS line assertion until header (type3) is sent [u sec]

Param.Name: Delay Header -> Data
Param.Desc: Delay between header to data [u sec]

Param.Name: Delay Data -> CS
Param.Desc: Delay between last data byte until CS deassertion [u sec]

Param.Name: TX Retry
Param.Desc: When HCI packet was splitted (due to slave request), try to complete the last packet [m sec]

Param.Name: Time between two consequtive HCI packets
Param.Desc: Time between two consequtive HCI packets [u sec]

Param.Name: eSPI Mode
Param.Desc: 0 = Disable (Don't work with DMA), 1 = Works with DMA

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: Configure SDIO error generation for Rx flow (NACK generation instead of ACK)

Param.Name: Random Mode
Param.Desc: 0 = Non random, 1 = Random mode (errors are generated at random times on random blocks)

Param.Name: Packet number
Param.Desc: Upon reception of which packet error will be generated. 0 - No error will be generated

Param.Name: Block number
Param.Desc: Upon reception of which SD block error generated.

Param.Name: Opcode

Param.Name: Time

Command.name: Set_IO_Pin_Mux_BTIP
Command.Macro:
_IO_Pin_Number = %1 _Mux_Select = %2 _BitShift = _IO_Pin_Number % 4 If _BitShift == 0 Then _BitShift = 4 End If _BitsToSend = _Mux_Select << 4*(_BitShift-1) _BitsMask = 15 << 4*(_BitShift-1) _Pin_Group = (_IO_Pin_Number-1) / 4 _Register_Address = 0x1af610 + (_Pin_Group << 1) log "Pin Number 0x%x", _IO_Pin_Number log "Mux_Select 0x%x", _Mux_Select log "_BitShift 0x%x", _BitShift log "_BitsToSend 0x%x", _BitsToSend log "_BitsMask 0x%x", _BitsMask log "_Pin_Group 0x%x", _Pin_Group log "_Register_Address 0x%x", _Register_Address
Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, _Register_Address, _BitsToSend, _BitsMask Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00

Command.name: Set_IO_Pin_Mux_Orca_top
Command.Macro:
_IO_Pin_Number = %1 _Mux_Select = %2 _BitShift = ((_IO_Pin_Number-1) % 2) * 8 _BitsToSend = _Mux_Select << _BitShift _BitsMask = 15 << _BitShift _Pin_Group = (_IO_Pin_Number-1) / 2 _Register_Address = 0x1a7c80 + (_Pin_Group << 1) If _Register_Address == 0x1a7c94 Then _Register_Address = 0x1a7c9A End If If _Register_Address == 0x1a7c8e Then _Register_Address = 0x1a7c94 End If If _Register_Address == 0x1a7c90 Then _Register_Address = 0x1a7c96 End If If _Register_Address == 0x1a7c92 Then _Register_Address = 0x1a7c98 End If
log "Pin Number 0x%x", _IO_Pin_Number log "Mux_Select 0x%x", _Mux_Select log "_BitShift 0x%x", _BitShift log "_BitsToSend 0x%x", _BitsToSend log "_BitsMask 0x%x", _BitsMask log "_Pin_Group 0x%x", _Pin_Group log "_Register_Address 0x%x", _Register_Address
Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, _Register_Address, _BitsToSend, _BitsMask Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00

Command.name: GCM_MUX_SIGNAL
Command.Macro:
_gcm_signal_number = %1 _pin_id = %2
log "_gcm_signal_number %d", _gcm_signal_number log "_pin_id %d", _pin_id
# Select GCM signals ############################
# Write to TEST SELECT REGISTER: # DRX is muxed out
# Generate TEST_SELECT_Register #value = _test_clk_mux_sel & 0xf #value = ((_dtst_mux_sel & 0xf) << 4) ^ value #value = ((_test_clock_invert & 0x1) << 8) ^ value #value = ((_inter_sel & 0xf) << 9) ^ value #value = ((_lsb_sel & 0x1) << 13) ^ value #value = ((_shl_sel & 0x1f) << 14) ^ value
#Send_HCI_VS_DRP_Write_Register 0xFD2A, 0x804, value #Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_DRP_Write_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_DRP_Write_Register, 0x00
#debug bus enable Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A3002, 0x0004, 0x0004 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 #enable test bus clock in gcm Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A6010, 0x0020, 0x0020 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
If (_pin_id == 1) Then #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A604c, _gcm_signal_number, 0x003f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0001, 0x0001 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 2) Then _gcm_signal_number_=_gcm_signal_number<<8 #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A604c, _gcm_signal_number_,0x3f00 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0002, 0x0002 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 3) Then #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A604e, _gcm_signal_number,0x003f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0004, 0x0004 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 4) Then _gcm_signal_number_=_gcm_signal_number<<8 #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A604e, _gcm_signal_number_,0x3f00 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0008, 0x0008 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 5) Then #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A6050, _gcm_signal_number,0x003f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0010, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 6) Then _gcm_signal_number_=_gcm_signal_number<<8 #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A6050, _gcm_signal_number_,0x3f00 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0020, 0x0020 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 7) Then #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A6052, _gcm_signal_number,0x003f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0040, 0x0040 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 8) Then _gcm_signal_number_=_gcm_signal_number<<8 #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A6052, _gcm_signal_number_,0x3f00 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0080, 0x0080 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 9) Then #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A6054, _gcm_signal_number,0x003f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0100, 0x0100 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If
If (_pin_id == 10) Then _gcm_signal_number_=_gcm_signal_number<<8 #put selected signal on selected dbg pin Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A6054, _gcm_signal_number_,0x3f00 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#select dbg pin from gcm and not from soc Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x001A605e, 0x0200, 0x0200 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 End If

Command.name: DRP_Mux_DTST
Command.Macro:
_test_mux_Signal_sel= %1 _dtst_Module_sel = %2 _shift_select= %3 _test_clk_mux_sel = %4 _test_dtst_enable = %5 _test_mirror_enable = %6 _test_apll_clk_select = %7 _TestBusOverrideSelect = %8 _TestBusOverrideValue = %9
# Dont Set config module settings ############################
#BTIP Configu module configuraton #Send_HCIPP_Set_IO_Pin_Mux_BTIP 0x01, 0x07
# Set debug module settings ###########################
# Write to TEST SELECT REGISTER: # DRX is muxed out
# DBG(9:5) Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A300C, 0x0000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
# DBG(4:0) Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A300A, 0x0000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
# DBG(15:0) enable Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A3002, 0x0004 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
#**************************************************************************# sleep 100 #**************************************************************************# #BTIP AOD module (GCM level) configuration(10 lsb's the other 7 by pass this module ) Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A605c, 0x0000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 #**************************************************************************# sleep 100 #**************************************************************************# #ORCA Top level configuration (Output Connector Pins )
# ORCA TOP_CONFIG # MUX DBG(15:0) & DBG_CLK on ORCA primary pins Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C82, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C84, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C86, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C88, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C8A, 0x0007 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C94, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C96, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C98, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C9A, 0x0707 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C9C, 0x1600 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
# configure CLK_REQ_OUT to be output & without pu/pd Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7C7E, 0x002F Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
# configure FM_SCL and FM_SDA NMODE Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001A7CAA, 0x000F Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, 0xFF01, 0x00
#******************* DRP DTST REG CONFIG *******************************************************#
#Clear dtst En Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, 0<<4, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
# WRITE test_mux_Signal_sel to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190204, _test_mux_Signal_sel, 0x00ff Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE _dtst_Module_sel to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190204, _dtst_Module_sel<<8, 0x0700 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE _shift_select to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190204, _shift_select<<12, 0xf000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE _test_clk_mux_sel to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, _test_clk_mux_sel, 0x000f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE _test_mirror_enable to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, _test_mirror_enable<<8, 0x0100 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE _test_apll_clk_select to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, _test_apll_clk_select<<12, 0x1000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
log "test_dtst_enable %d", _test_dtst_enable if _test_dtst_enable > 0 then
# WRITE _test_dtst_enable to DTST_CTRL Register # Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, 0x1B, 0x001f # Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE DTST Enable to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, _test_dtst_enable<<4, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE _test_apll_clk_select to DTST_CTRL Register end if
Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00191260,0, 0x0001 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
if _test_clk_mux_sel > 3 & _test_clk_mux_sel < 7 then # WRITE _test_mirror_enable to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00191260,1, 0x0001 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 else Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00191260,0, 0x0001 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 end if log "test_dtst_enable %d", _test_dtst_enable
#******************* DRP DTST REG CONFIG END *******************************************************#
#******************* DRP DTST Bus Override *******************************************************# # WRITE TestBusOverrideSelect to Register Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x0019021e, _TestBusOverrideSelect Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
# WRITE TestBusOverrideValue to Register Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x0019021c, _TestBusOverrideValue Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
if _TestBusOverrideSelect > 0 then # WRITE _test_mirror_enable to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190102, 1<<12, 0x1000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE _test_apll_clk_select to DTST_CTRL Register end if #******************* DRP DTST Bus Override End *******************************************************#

Param.Name: shift_select
Param.Desc: 0 - Select Number of bits to mux

Param.Name: test_clk_mux_sel
Param.Desc: Selects the output clock on test_clk output

Command.name: DRP_DTST_Memory_Conf
Command.Macro:
_DTST_Mem_Mode = %1 _DTST_Mem_Enable = %2 _DTST_Enable = %3 _DTST_Signal_sel = %4 _DTST_Module_sel = %5 _DTST_Clk_Sel = %6 _DTST_Mem_Max_Use = %7 _DTST_Mem_Step_Size = %8 _DTST_Mem_Word_Select = %9 _DTST_Mem_Offset = %10 _DTST_Mem_Wrap_Enable = %11 _DTST_Sleep_Time = %12 _DTST_Mem_Reading_Enable = %13 _DTST_filename = %14
Send_HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register 0xFF00, 0x00190218 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register, 0x00, &DtstParamL Send_HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register 0xFF00, 0x0019021a Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register, 0x00, &DtstParamM Send_HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register 0xFF00, 0x00190210 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register, 0x00, &DtstMemCtrl Send_HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register 0xFF00, 0x00190206 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register, 0x00, &DtstCtrl Send_HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register 0xFF00, 0x00190214 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register, 0x00, &saveddtst
#******************* DRP DTST REG CONFIG *******************************************************#
#Dmem Flag Register=0 Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001932D6, 0x0 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#config DTST_MEM_SIG_REC_PARAMS # config DTST_Mem_Max_Use DTST_Mem_Max_Use=(_DTST_Mem_Max_Use*1024)-1 Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190218, DTST_Mem_Max_Use, 0x0fff Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config DTST_Mem_Step_Size Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190218, _DTST_Mem_Step_Size<<12, 0x1000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config DTST_Mem_Word_Select Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190218, _DTST_Mem_Word_Select<<13, 0x2000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config DTST_Mem_Mem_Offset Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x0019021a, _DTST_Mem_Offset, 0x0fff Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config DTST_Mem_Wrap_Enable Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x0019021a, _DTST_Mem_Wrap_Enable<<12, 0x1000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 #DTST_MEM_STOP_ADDR #Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x00190226, 1 #Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#config DTST_MEM_CTRL # config _DTST_Mem_Mode Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, _DTST_Mem_Mode<<2, 0x000c Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config _DTST_Mem_Addr_Load Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, 0x0001<<4, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 Sleep 10 # config _DTST_Mem_Enable Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, _DTST_Mem_Enable, 0x0001 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#Config DTST_CTRL register
#Disable DTST Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206,0x00000 , 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 #config signal_select Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190204,_DTST_Signal_sel , 0x00ff Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config module_select Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190204,_DTST_Module_sel<<8 , 0x0700 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config Clk_select Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206,_DTST_Clk_Sel , 0x000f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 sleep 1
# config _DTST_Enable DTST CTRL (enable/disable the DTST) Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206,_DTST_Enable<<4 , 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#Enable the rx_start cortex 0x001932D6 This register set in the DMEM Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x001932D6, 0x1 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
# wait DTST_Sleep_Time micro-sec sleep _DTST_Sleep_Time+5
#************************************************end recording ************************************************************# # config DTST_Mem_Wrap_Enable =0 Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x0019021a, 0<<12, 0x1000 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 Sleep 1000 # config _DTST_Mem_Enable=0 Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, 0, 0x0001 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE DTST Disable to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, 0<<4, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#************************************************************************************************************#
#******************* DRP DTST mem writing End *******************************************************# if (_DTST_Mem_Reading_Enable) Then ################################################### # read the recorded signals ################################################### #FileName1="C:\Temp\DTST_results_int.txt" # FileName2="C:\Temp\DTST_results_uint.txt" #FileName3="C:\Temp\DTST_results_hex.txt" FileName1=_DTST_filename+"_int.txt" FileName2=_DTST_filename+"_uint.txt" FileName3=_DTST_filename+"_hex.txt"
#record signals
#************************************************************************************************************# clk_select=0x0b
# WRITE _test_clk_mux_sel to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, clk_select, 0x000f Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 sleep 1 # config _DTST_Mem_Mode=2 Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, 2<<2, 0x000c Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 #Read Stop_Address Send_HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register 0xFF00, 0x00190224 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Hardware_Register, 0x00, &stp_addr #pause "stop adr = %d",stp_addr
#DTST_MEM_OCP_PARAMS - write start_address Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x00190216, stp_addr+1 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config _DTST_Mem_Enable=1 Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, 1, 0x0001 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # WRITE DTST Enable to DTST_CTRL Register Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190206, 1<<4, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config _DTST_Mem_Addr_Load =1 Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, 0x0001<<4, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 sleep 10
#save results to file WriteFile FileName1, 0, "" #save results to file WriteFile FileName2, 0, "" #save results to file WriteFile FileName3, 0, ""
for loop=0 to (DTST_Mem_Max_Use )
if (stp_addr==DTST_Mem_Max_Use) Then stp_addr=0 #DTST_MEM_OCP_PARAMS - write start_address Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x00190216, stp_addr Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 # config _DTST_Mem_Addr_Load =1 Send_HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFD09, 0x00190210, 0x0001<<4, 0x0010 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Modify_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 else stp_addr+=1 End If
Send_HCI_VS_Read_Memory 0xFF02, 0x00190200, 04 Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Read_Memory_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Read_Memory, 0x00, &val1
if _DTST_Mem_Step_Size < 1 then
valL = val1&0x0000ffff valHT = val1&0xffff0000 valH = valHT >> 16
Log "value=0x%x (%d) , iteration %d of %d", val1,val1,loop*2,DTST_Mem_Max_Use*2 WriteFile FileName1, 1, " %d\n",valL WriteFile FileName2, 1, " %u\n",valL WriteFile FileName3, 1, " %x\n",valL WriteFile FileName1, 1, " %d\n",valH WriteFile FileName2, 1, " %u\n",valH WriteFile FileName3, 1, " %x\n",valH
else
Log "value=0x%x (%d) , iteration %d of %d", val1,val1,loop,DTST_Mem_Max_Use WriteFile FileName1, 1, " %d\n",val1 WriteFile FileName2, 1, " %u\n",val1 WriteFile FileName3, 1, " %x\n",val1
endif
next #end of recording End If
Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x00190218, DtstParamL Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x0019021a, DtstParamL Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x00190210, DtstMemCtrl Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x00190206, DtstCtrl Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00 Send_HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register 0xFF01, 0x00190214, saveddtst Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Hardware_Register_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Hardware_Register, 0x00
#************************************************************************************************************#

Param.Name: DTST_Clk_Sel
Param.Desc: Selects the output clock on test_clk output

Param.Name: DTST_Mem_Word_Select
Param.Desc: Selects DTST Mem Word MSB LSB

Param.Name: DTST_Mem_Offset
Param.Desc: 1-Selects the DTST Mem Offset up to 4KByte

Param.Name: DTST_sleep_time
Param.Desc: Selects how length of the recording procudure in us (sleep between redord enable/disable

Param.Name: DTST_filename
Param.Desc: Chose the Path and filename to save NO filename sufix needed

Command.name: DRP_Power_Levels_Setting
Command.Macro:
_GFSKPowerValue= %1 _GFSKDeltaPowerValue = %2 _EDR2PowerValue = %3 _EDR2DeltaPowerValue= %4 _EDR3PowerValue = %5 _EDR3DeltaPowerValue = %6
#enter power levels here GFSKPowerValueT=_GFSKPowerValue GFSKDeltaPowerValueT=_GFSKDeltaPowerValue EDR2PowerValueT=_EDR2PowerValue EDR2DeltaPowerValueT=_EDR2DeltaPowerValue EDR3PowerValueT=_EDR3PowerValue EDR3DeltaPowerValueT=_EDR3DeltaPowerValue
FileNameGFSK="C:\Temp\GFSKPowerSet.txt" FileNameEDR2="C:\Temp\EDR2PowerSet.txt" FileNameEDR3="C:\Temp\EDR3PowerSet.txt"
LoopNom=15
#GFSK LOOP WriteFile FileNameGFSK, 0,"GFSKPowerValue=\"" for loop=0 to ( LoopNom ) GFSKPowerValueT=GFSKPowerValueT-GFSKDeltaPowerValueT valLT = GFSKPowerValueT&0x00ff valHT = GFSKPowerValueT&0xff00 valH = valHT >> 8 valL = valLT << 8 GFSKPowerValue=valL+valH WriteFile FileNameGFSK,1, "%x",GFSKPowerValue next WriteFile FileNameGFSK, 1, "\""
#GFSK LOOP WriteFile FileNameEDR2, 0,"EDR2PowerValue=\"" for loop=0 to ( LoopNom ) EDR2PowerValueT=EDR2PowerValueT-EDR2DeltaPowerValueT valLT = EDR2PowerValueT&0x00ff valHT = EDR2PowerValueT&0xff00 valH = valHT >> 8 valL = valLT << 8 EDR2PowerValue=valL+valH WriteFile FileNameEDR2,1, "%x",EDR2PowerValue next WriteFile FileNameEDR2, 1, "\""
#EDR3 LOOP WriteFile FileNameEDR3, 0,"EDR3PowerValue=\"" for loop=0 to ( LoopNom ) EDR3PowerValueT=EDR3PowerValueT-EDR3DeltaPowerValueT valLT = EDR3PowerValueT&0x00ff valHT = EDR3PowerValueT&0xff00 valH = valHT >> 8 valL = valLT << 8 EDR3PowerValue=valL+valH WriteFile FileNameEDR3,1, "%x",EDR3PowerValue next WriteFile FileNameEDR3, 1, "\""
callfile "C:\Temp\GFSKPowerSet.txt" callfile "C:\Temp\EDR2PowerSet.txt" callfile "C:\Temp\EDR3PowerSet.txt"
#write GFSK POWER values Send_HCI_VS_Write_Memory_Block 0xFF05, 0x193356, 32,GFSKPowerValue Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Memory_Block_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Memory_Block, 0x00
#write EDR2 POWER values Send_HCI_VS_Write_Memory_Block 0xFF05, 0x193376, 32,EDR2PowerValue Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Memory_Block_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Memory_Block, 0x00
#write EDR3 POWER values Send_HCI_VS_Write_Memory_Block 0xFF05, 0x193396, 32,EDR3PowerValue Wait_HCI_Command_Complete_VS_Write_Memory_Block_Event 5000, any, HCI_VS_Write_Memory_Block, 0x00
